ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: Apple Silicon Engineering is seeking creative engineers to design the next generation of analog & mixed-signal (AMS) circuits for Apple’s world-leading systems-on-chip (SOCs). Apple’s Ax SOCs are the brain of every iPhone and iPad. Our AMS circuits connect them to the physical world. Examples include SERDES for data communication, PLLs for clock generation, and sensors for measuring all sorts of physical quantities.

ul.li: Experience writing software in C / C++
Understand design specs and requirements for AMS circuits, including SERDES, PLLs, data converters, and/or sensor circuits
AMS circuit modeling in MATLAB, Simulink, SystemVerilog, and/or VerilogA(MS)
Simulation tools for analog, digital, and mixed-signal circuits
Logic design in Verilog, VHDL, or other HDL(s)
System modeling in SystemC, SpecC, etc.
Architectural design of SERDES, PLL, and/or sensor circuits
Design of software for parallel and/or distributed execution
Familiarity with modern software development practices
Familiarity with SOC analyses and build processes: static timing, EM/ IR drop, formal verification, CDC, etc.

div.p:
AMS Design & Modeling Engineers have two core responsibilities:
Design software to model the behavior and performance of AMS circuits Use this software to design better circuits - from architecture through design and verification
BS, EE/ CE (or related fields), plus 2 years relevant experience, or MS/ PhD, EE/ CE (or related fields)
